Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: News & Updates   Hello everyone! We haven’t discussed Faceter with you recently, but it’s all for good reason. We have come a long way in terms of creating a new product, the functionality of which hasn’t been developed before. This is a very time-consuming process that requires full commitment and the use of all possible resources. But now we have something we can’t wait to share with you! But first we will answer perhaps your most popular question:  What’s up with the Faceter App? Apple users can go to the App Store and download the Faceter application right now. This version of the application will allow to test all of the features of Faceter app. Later, this opportunity will appear also for Android users.  For those of you who just want to see how the application works without downloading it, we have prepared a short video.  In this video you can see how convenient the application is, as well as how easy it is to work with video stream and archives in the Faceter application. You can easily switch between dates and cameras, select the desired video segments and save or send it. You can also go to full-screen mode or zoom in on any frame. As you may know, we’ve also launched a beta test and you can join testing here.  Development Those who have been with us for a long time will probably remember that initially, in the MVP, all the functionality of Faceter was contained in one application. However, at the beginning we set ourselves a very ambitious goal: to make Faceter convenient and useful for very different people and industries, including businesses, manufacturing, private users, etc. The more we developed the product, the more we realised that our initial understanding of the product required significant improvement in order to reach our goal.  We worked with hundreds of cameras and dozens of manufacturers. We knew about all the chaos in the market, about the complete absence of a single principle of operation, and about a huge number of errors in the protocols with which cameras work. Eventually we came to the conclusion that in order for us to be able to scale the product and to make it truly convenient it’s not the best application that we need, but the best ecosystem in which each product solves a separate task. By combining them into a system, we will get the Faceter that we have been planning to create.  For the user this does not change anything, but outside of their smartphone or web browser there will now be a large, well-structured mechanism. After months of planning, today we are able to reveal some of the details concerning its structure:  The first part is the Video Surveillance Server by Faceter. It connects and collects audio and video streams from cameras, maintains an archive, provides API access to the archive and to the cameras. It also transfers data to mobile apps.  The second is Face Recognition by Faceter, which is a recognition server and analytics system. It connects to the video archive and analyzes the video / audio streams stored there.  Look out for more exciting product announcements in the near future on the entire Faceter ecosystem, how the miners and users of the service will interact, and how and why it will be as convenient as possible. We’re working very hard on development at the moment, and we promise to keep you all updated throughout each step of this exciting process.  What’s new Now for a little more about our achievements in the development of Faceter. Our team have been tirelessly working on improving the Faceter video surveillance platform, with a focus on stability and performance. We’ve had a lot of positive feedback from our first testers and customers, and we’ve worked really hard to make sure our product is as user-friendly as possible. Here are some of Faceter’s cutting-edge features:  Motion recognition and smart video recording Faceter now only records a video when a movement has been recognized.   This will significantly reduce the data storage. Just imagine how much less space you’ll need to store video data! This feature makes it much more convenient to record at night or to activate video surveillance of the warehouse, for example.  Work with the archive This the feature we are most proud of, as it has not been implemented in such a useful way in any other product we’ve come across so far. In the video below, you can see how fast and easy it is to interact with the video archive. You can navigate to any point in the timeline without having to wait for it to load. Instead you have a whole video canvas, and you can instantly switch to any frame from the archive. Isn’t that fantastic?  Sound recording Moreover, in the near future Faceter will be able to record audio in AAC format to the archive and play it on mobile clients. However, don’t forget to make sure your camera supports this particular format first.  Faceter.io update Soon we will update the website with a personal account and a demo version of the web application, giving you an opportunity to try it out on your desktop.   Don’t forget to stay in touch, and follow us on Twitter, Facebook & Reddit for more exciting updates.  Yours, The Faceter team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: How Face Recognition Actually Works  Hi, I'm Vladimir, Faceter's CTO. Today I would like to talk to you about the finer details of face recognition technology and how Faceter works. There are a lot of technical details ahead - don't say we didn't warn you!  Many people believe that deep neural networks recognise faces. Actually, that's not quite right. A neural network allows you to extract a set of unique key features (facial features vector) from a face. Only then it is possible to identify/verify a person by comparing these key characteristics.  Usually, the key features are a set of N numbers (N = 32–2048 - in our case N = 128). The problem is that although we said that facial features vector is unique to each person, in fact, the vectors extracted from one person's different photos will be slightly different. Therefore, we cannot compare vectors element-wise.    A classic way of comparing two vectors is to obtain the Euclidean distance between them. Click on the link if you are interested in how it is actually calculated (https://hlab.stanford.edu/brian/euclidean_distance_in.html).  The lesser the distance between vectors is, the more similar the images will be. Therefore, to compare two people we will need to calculate the distance between their facial features vectors. If the distance is sufficiently small (less than a certain threshold), then we decide that it is the same person; if not, they must be different people.  Let's imagine that we have a database of 1 million people (it means that we have 1 million facial features vectors), and we need to find the most similar face to a reference person's face. In other words, we need to calculate 1 million vector distances between the reference person and the people in the database, and choose the smallest one. With such large volumes of data, this operation becomes quite resource intensive. Our R&D team wrote an implementation of the proximity search algorithm using the GPU, which shows very high performance - over 60 million comparisons per second. However, we are always searching for new ways to optimize our algorithms, and now we are examining an approach called DeepHash.    Using this approach, the neural network not only learns to extract facial vector features during the training process, but also learns to quantify the features of one person into a single unique hash that remains unique for every photo of this person. In this case, we can use the simplest hash comparison operation to compare facial hashes. This approach will create an incremental increase in the search/comparison performance of individuals.  If you are interested in such posts "from behind the scenes", leave your feedback, likes and feel free to repost. From time to time, my colleagues and I will be happy to share our thoughts, experiences, and the latest updates with you.  Stay tuned!  Vladimir, Faceter CTO

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Tech Update #4  Hello, everyone! We have prepared again an update and exciting news for you about how Faceter software development is proceeding. Today, we will tell you how things are going in Android development, explain new functionality and show you a few fresh screenshots.  Debugging Before the Launch Since the project is gradually approaching the stage of the first public release, we are increasingly focusing on the sustainability and the correct work of the application. If the last time we talked about a biggish list of bugs that had been fixed, then this time we have reworked the layout of both mobile applications. The new version became much lighter. It allowed us to increase applications’ effectiveness on all devices. Also, we simplified the interface. So as the test results show, the app is more intuitive now. Very soon, you will be able to test our achievements by yourself!  Android-Version Is On Board! We are happy to announce that, as we assumed earlier, the Android-development team has overtaken the iOS team, and the recognition technology has started to work in the Android-version of the application. Yes, we still have a lot of work and tests to do, but another big target is behind.  New Features: Video Data Saving and ID Signing There is a new function of playing the saved video in the web version and both mobile applications. Moreover, if the video was not saved for whatever reason, Faceter will notify you and even name the cause or error. By the way, as for the “missing fragments error” — if you have an original idea on the “screensaver” for the situation when the video has not been saved (poor connection, cut a piece, etc.), then please share it with us and the community. Use the hashtag #backout_faceter on social media — we will be very thankful for all your outstanding ideas. Please, do not offer an image of the girl from “The Ring” movie!  Besides, Faceter has one more important function — now, you can sign recognized people according to their names/nicknames from the profile if a camera has caught them. Being able to determine intruders is much more convenient!  New Screenshots   Finally, we are very excited to show you several new application screenshots. Do you have any comments on this? Then please do not hesitate to share them with us — as long as the development is in the process, we are particularly interested in what you are thinking about our project!  That’s all for now. Before the next tech update, you will receive a very important piece of news that will cheer you up and will not leave anyone indifferent. What is it exactly? Let’s say, there is a hint in the previous updates. However, it is not necessary to play detective — there is very little time left!  See you in a couple of weeks.  Yours, Faceter team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Tech Update #5 Hello Everyone! As the finish line is getting closer and closer and the adrenaline is pumping, we can’t wait to share our latest news and achievements with you. Let's get started!  Work with the archive. We have already mentioned the function of saving the video, but we have only finished working on it this month. Even if there is a lack of free space the system will continue to work stably, overwriting old material and giving priority to the last 24 hours of the video recording. We also updated the player with the archiving function and improved the user interface—we’re sure you’ll love it!  Express your opinion: we are thinking about implementing a new function that allows users to record a video only during the active moments (when there are any actions in the camera field). This will greatly optimize space management, but this option is not suitable for everyone. What do you think? Would you find this function useful?    Performance improvement. Earlier we used third-party solutions to have an opportunity to work on the UI, but now we’ve switched to our own developments. This will allow our users to get better performance with less resources. For example, video playback function (HLS on Demand).  Time & Attendance. There are new basic functions of Time & Attendance, and this feature also allows users to receive reports with repeated visits. To configure this new functionality, you hardly need to do anything—just set up the cameras. By comparison, with other similar solutions it is necessary to set up work shifts, work schedules for different groups of people, etc. We also provide the real-time uploading of data from Faceter to any ready-made T & A systems. This can be very useful if some corporate clients currently use another system.  Recognition system update. We continue to improve the algorithms of the recognition itself, primarily through the tracking of new technologies and approaches, testing and, if necessary, implementation. During this development session, the standout example of such work was the use of the Deep Wise Convolution layer in our latest version of the face detection network. The use of such layers in a neural network makes it possible to obtain a significant performance increase with minimal loss in quality of detection.  By the way, if you think that our work consists of sitting down behind the monitor, then you are mistaken! Developers of smart video surveillance systems have to overcome quite large distances at work. See for yourself.  Beta-test. Finally, the time has come. We are pleased to announce that soon you to will be able to try out Faceter in the real world. We are finishing the final preparations, and very soon we will invite everyone who wants to participate in the beta testing of the full version of Faceter to be a part of this grand testing. You will need a suitable camera and a few minutes of free time to set up, and to learn about the start of the beta testing you will need to keep up to date with us on social media.  That's all for today! See you again in a few weeks, as well as at the upcoming beta testing.  Yours, Faceter Team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Q&A #3  Hello everyone! Here we answer your most common questions. We noticed that you often ask us about the software itself, its price, and different versions. You ask about how it looks now, how it will look at the launch, and what will happen after the mass-market version is released. Well, let's shed some light on these topics...  Are the functionality and interface of the corporate and mass-market versions different? Good question. For now, we have decided to develop both versions within a single codebase since we are working on key functions that are important for both development branches. Further, the corporate and mass-market versions will again be separated. However, most of the functions and their UI representation will stay the same.  How much is the corporate version? The cost of the corporate version depends on the number of licensed cameras. The cost of one license, including integration, starts from $30 per month.  Does the B2B version use a decentralized network or centralized servers? Both options are possible, depending on the customer’s preferences.  Will the B2C version be updated on a regular basis? Of course. We are currently working on convenient mobile applications for iOS and Android, as well as on affordable cloud storage for the mass market. However, we are not going to stop there and will continue to improve Faceter. We have something to surprise you with;)  Can I install the app and have a look? Yes! You will have such opportunity soon. Prepare your CCTV cameras, because beta-testing is coming;)  That's all for today!  Please share your questions and ideas with us via social media, or email ask@faceter.io. We’d love to hear from you!  Faceter Team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hi, everyone!  We’re really excited to announce that we’re finally ready to start the accumulation of data for beta testing. Most importantly, we’re ready to test Faceter software on real CCTV systems for the benefit of our future customers. That’s where you come in!  We are inviting everyone who wants to participate and has all the necessary skills and equipment, to take part in the closed beta-testing of our product. It’s an excellent opportunity to become one of the first to try Faceter’s smart video surveillance for the home, office, or production facility.  Requirements: - You are a confident PC user, and able to follow instructions carefully. - You have at least one CCTV camera (NOT wide-angle and NOT dome).  If this sounds like you, please click this link and fill in the questionnaire. Our support team will contact you as soon as possible, once everything we need will be ready for the test.  Finally, we’d like to thank all of you who have supported us up to now. We hope you’re just as excited as we are about taking the next step towards a fantastic future of Faceter!

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Tech News from RnD Hello Everyone! As the time goes, our developers are preparing new features for both Business-to-Business and Business-to-Customer solutions. Today we are happy to tell you about our new Business-to-Business tool, aimed to help mainly in Sales, Marketing and Workforce management.  Have you ever wished to know how much time people need in average to order pizza or choose milk in the supermarket? Or why receptionist always mopes around, but is never on his place to register you? Our devs wish to know that too and to allow our customers to know that. They thought of a tool, that would allow to analyse the customer attendance and get the proper statistics on the time spent in each customised zone or the tool, that would allow to track the crew behaviour in the customer area. That is how that feature was born in our RnD department.  If you work with video surveillance, you might know, that many cameras or surveillance providers do support a kind of the same feature, but you are drown in countless in range notifications, border cross notifications etc. etc. Our dev team wants to convert this chaotic information flow into a useful and meaningful analytic tool, that can be utilized for several business needs.  There are other features already integrated to the Business-to-Business solution, but they do not allow to track specific zones and apply analytics to them. By applying this feature user receives an integrated analytics tool, that foster sales by better merchandising or factor into changes in workforce management.  See how it looks like to have different zones on the camera stream:   Timeline This feature is specifically designed to handle analytics, that is why user needs to set up two main parameters once and system will be all set:  define zones “Customer zone”, “Merchant zone”, “Pastry zone” etc.; set up different timeframes , such as “Working Hours”, “Closed” etc. Hereinafter the application will show appearance analytics based on this times and zones. See for yourself:     Comprehensible Analytics People want to have vivid graphics instead of numbers , that is why we have also added a board, that shows attendance time on a pie chart:   Each tool helps business to sell and all of us to work more efficient and have more free time, that you’ve used to read this article. If you are interested in more tech details of this solution — do not hesitate to comment and we will prepare our next material on some dev details of our new feature.  Yours, Faceter Team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: One Thousand and One Faceter  Hello everyone! While we are working on mobile applications and preparing to launch production-ready versions this winter for everyone, we suggest you to dream just a little with us!  Faceter is a technology that can change our ordinary way of life even in much more ways than we could imagine at the beginning of the development.  Each time new members joined our team, there were fresh interpretations of how our project can make everyday life more convenient, world safer and business more successful.  Here are just a few options for how, in theory, of course, Faceter technology can be applied:  Intelligent video surveillance can be taught to recognise objects that you need and find them — for example, keys, smartphone, or maybe your shirt. It will allow you to always stay up to date with your customer’s mood, or to monitor students during the lecture, to determine their weak sides in studying. Moreover, maybe it’s time for the movie makers and producers to know which of their jokes and ideas are unsuccessful among the viewers — just install Faceter video surveillance system in movie houses to determine the problems of modern cinematography vividly. Of course, Faceter can warn you about uninvited guests and their aggressive intentions. Moreover, Faceter can distinguish not only objects, but also actions — it is possible to anticipate crimes, emergencies at a workplace or, for example, wildfires (greetings to Australians, we know that it is a quite big problem for your country).  In other words, ideas of using Faceter technology are limited only by imagination. So if all these awesome ideas were invented only by our team, then imagine how many ideas of Faceter technology implementation we can come up with together with our community.  Offer your funny, entertaining, crazy, innovative and valuable ways of using Faceter in the comments to this post in our social media and Telegram chat. Our support managers will select the most unusual, useful and funny suggestions and we will share the results of this challenge with you in early August.  To make your message more visible and easy to find, please put a hashtag #1001Faceter to your comment.  If you want your suggestion to be noticed, then write us at ask@faceter.io with a note in the message topic “One Thousand and One Faceter”. Such messages will be read and considered without any chance to get lost.  The authors of the most original answers will be specially rewarded by Faceter.  That’s all for now, stay tuned!  Yours, Faceter Team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hello everyone! Today we summarise the results of our 1000 and 1 Faceter event. And we want to thank everyone who took part in this — we received a lot of food for thoughts and had a lot of fun. Let us show you the most interesting answers. So, come on!  Felix Faceter can be used for “check in” at work. I think a lot of people hate their cards, that can be forgotten at home or another jacket. Yes, you are right. This is a great idea, and it is quite simple to realise. We hope that in the next 5 years we will forget the phrase “Oh, f#@$! I forgot my card again”  Shawn Smith Faceter Face could be used in the medical field to detect certain “abnormalities”, as the human eye can detect illness. This future development is possible but we have a long way to go before computer vision will be able to help doctors. However, medical diagnostics is a promising and decent field for Faceter.  Faceter could be used as a supplementary tool in lie detection methods. Shawn, most likely, it is possible. But we are not sure that some representatives of business or politics can be brought out by any of the existing technologies. Even Faceter can’t do this .  Artificial Intelligence Faceter to spy after your wife while you are not at home if she has a lover. It is better to keep some things in secret…  Miroslav Faceter You can definitely use this to avoid girls you already slept with, didn’t call them and forgot their faces. Oh, Mirosav, Miroslav…Please, do not do it, please. Be a decent man  Shrinivas Dontul Faceter can be integrated with Adhaar System of India to make a foolproof system for providing corruption free system in India where sometimes Biometric system fails to recognise the fingerprints of people due to which poor ppl were denied ration. Faceter can help many companies manage stress of their employees. Behavioural pattern analysed by faceter can generate alerts to company management about who is stressed how much and who is happy, healthy and fit etc.. companies will do better if they are able to manage their employey better with Faceter behavioural analysis. Faceter will be used by Major political parties in the world because these political people are all the time under the scanner. In India, these political people meet all sorts of people and do corruption and are never caught. With faceter at least these people records will be maintained with a timeline hence some facts can be established in corruptions cases based on faceter data. We hope that our project will especially develop its software in such fields. Because there are a lot of places in the world where justice and humanity need extra control and monitoring. Thank you, Shrinivas.   And again Shrinivas Dontul May be in future Faceter would be able to tell how many mosquitos are flying around in a Room. 😂😁 So that we can take appropriate action on mosquitos. Are you sure you want to know the exact number?    Ries_NL🇳🇱 Faceter and then team up with cappasity for their 3d modelling software to make a perfect 3d rendering of a fugitive instead of a mugshot. Or in case of missing persons and such. It is a great idea, such opportunities will find application also in animation, game dev and movie making.  David Ring Faceter a mobile app that detects plants and creates a map of all the plants in your garden. Oh, David, good idea! The development of recognition technology can help us to go much further — educational applications for zoos, reserves and parks. Just imagine that in some time it can turn into a pocket guide, like Pokedex in the Pokémon universe, but with much more opportunities for a user.    Marek Jantos Faceter can be used in the shops to prevent underage teenagers buying alcohol and tobacco. Marek, it is entirely possible in the nearest future. But, we really wonder if teens can get around this protection?  Simon Goldsmith Today I was going for a jog, and there was a woman sitting there taking notes of the types of people using the footpath. I looked up and spotted CCTV cameras. One could always send that feed to a Faceter system which could differentiate between cyclists, joggers, mums with kids etc and aggregate details about what kind of people use the paths, you could also track the same people across different CCTV to see how much of the pathway is actually used… This kind of thing could be good for traffic management/planning. Simon, you are absolutely right. Hopefully, the collection of statistical data in any social sphere will become much easier with the development of our technology.  Harvey Beast Faceter to find out who eats all the sweets in the fridge at nights.  @Key65111031 With FACETER, you can finally find out who is my sandwich at work!  Andy I hope faceter gets installed in my office kitchen, so I can figure out which one of my co-workers keeps stealing my milk and sandwiches from the fridge each day! 😂 Guys, we are delighted that you entrust us with such difficult life questions, but let us show you one more solution — a little portion of laxative will help not only reveal the thief, but also to wean him or her from this guilty pleasure. Some issues can be solved without intelligent video surveillance  Ashley Hunter Faceter to be installed at schools to find out who skips lessons Poor kids…  And the most exciting thing, all our participants are waiting for — the competition results! Our support managers have selected the most unusual, useful and funny suggestions and here are 3 people, who have made their best according to our committee: 1. The unbeatable leader Shrinivas Dontul @shrinivasdontul; 2. The use-case author Felix @felixthefelix; 3. The most funny case creator Artificial Intelligence @ArtificialIT; Please contact us at support@faceter.io with the subject: “#1001Faceter winner”. We have some special “thanks” for you 😉 We were happy to see your ideas and decided to give you one more chance to participate. If you have any ideas, continue sharing with us and may be next time your idea will be chosen as the most outstanding one.  It is all for today! Send us more exciting and funny options for using the computer vision technology. You can do it via all social media with hashtag #1001Faceter or in the comments below. We will definitely publish the most catchy and funny ones.  Stay tuned!  Yours, Faceter Team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hello everyone!  The market situation may not give us even a day of rest, but that doesn’t threaten us! Our team is working on the production-ready version of our product and its early launch, so it is quite busy out here. Coffee mugs are stored in the sink; pizza and energy drinks are supplied with an enviable frequency! By the way, our devs moved into a new office not so long ago. Congratulations to them!    To brighten up an uninterrupted flow of negative news from the cryptocurrency market, let us tell you what we’ve been doing lately. We have something interesting.  Firstly, like any other IT-project, we are facing many bugs during the development process. So it is just that time to improve our software in all possible ways and clean up the code.  Here are a few bugs that we fixed recently: Arranged update for the history of visits. Optimised processes of making and linking of user profiles; Created a manageable update for the history of visits; “Cleaned” and organized a people directory; Stabilized the face recognition interface; Error notifications became user-friendly; Fixed camera search errors on the dashboard; Completed parameters for the search of visits; Arranged update for the history of visits.  Thus far, this is what we can tell you for now;)  Secondly, as for more important updates and news, our developers are now making a huge effort in the field of creating cloud storage for videos coming from cameras. Below you can see the intermediate results of how the flow through the saved video stream will be organized.    We specifically tried to make the interface as simple and convenient as possible. And it seems to us that this is exactly how it turned out! The interface we created takes into account the needs of both ordinary users and experienced security professionals who need to monitor every frame.  iOS developers are now working on the direct connection to IP cameras, while Android devs are integrating the application with a computer vision. As for the web team, they will almost get to rest (just joking!) and make a lot of various improvements and debugging.  A little bit of humor from our developers — there are new functions which have been added to the MVP-version that allow you to delete a visit or to ignore someone. Now you can hide the fact that you’ve stolen someone else’s yogurt from the office refrigerator (of course, if you are the boss or the head of the security department), or hide the fact that you have a secret lover. But we still advise you not to do any of these things, especially stealing other people’s yogurts.  Finally, the most exciting news — Faceter developers prepared an installation version for corporate clients with a lot of cool features, including an embryo of a neural network, which is placed on a USB flash drive. At the same time, there is an active study of various solutions for organizing video storage and working with SONM is taking place.  Taking into account that the development is moving forward at a very good speed and that the project will be ready to hit the market very soon, we would like to know what video hardware you’ve ever used or plan to use. Here are some manufacturers.  Help us find out which one you prefer: Amcrest Foscam Lorex Reolink Mobotix Vivotek Zmodo Sricam Defeway Panasonic SpyTek  That’s all for today!  See you in a couple of weeks.  Yours, Faceter team

Fill the fields the bot sends you in the private chat, you will be asked the following: 1. What is your KuCoin account email address; 2. Project name you want to get listed (spell the name in full “Faceter”, DON’T USE THE TICKER); 3. What is special about this project, why should it be listed on the exchange. Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hello Everyone!  As previously planned, we continue to share with you all the news about our main achievements in the developing of a commercial version of the product. And today we have something to show again. Let's start with the good news for our partners.  Install Faceter now! We are pleased to inform you that the corporate version of Faceter for business customers is ready for setting. The installation will be quite easy if there is suitable hardware and an engineer. You need to follow the attached instructions and make sure that your system meets the requirements. If you are interested in the corporate version of Faceter, please contact our sales department at sales@faceter.io.  Integration with SONM! On 4th of July, we begin to work on integration with the decentralised supercomputer SONM. The anticipation of the first results of this cooperation is so exciting - fog computing is coming!  Web version We haven't said anything about the development process of a web-based version of our application for a long time, but now the time has come. We are working on an updated design in general and creating a user interface for the new tools. Images are attached! The web version has a new function - appending of a Digital Video Recorder (a digital video recorder which is connected with N-quantity of IP cameras). Below there is a script for this function.    Besides, we've improved the entire user interface of the user account. Now it is more convenient to use and looks more like our mobile version.    Integration of smart vision with the application As we told you earlier, one of the Faceter teams led by the CTO continues to teach our neural network with new "tricks" and increases the recognition quality. But until today it was just technology in a vacuum. And it makes our announcement especially joyful because we have started the integration of "computer vision" possibilities into customer application on iOS. At the end of this process, Faceter's primary function will be available to all users directly through the smartphones' screens.  This is one of the most important moments for the whole project. Celebrate it with us!  Since the last update, we have made a significant step forward, and we are not planning to stop in the process of development racing. A more important step is ahead, and we want to be well-prepared for it. Here is a small teaser for you:  We are considering the possibility of launching an open beta. And we want to involve a group of participants who are ready to be a tester and want to contribute to the Faceter development.  Now we are not ready to disclose specific details, but if you want to be the first to know about this possibility, then subscribe to our social networks and follow us there. We will tell more when it will be the right time.  It is all for now, see you in a couple of weeks!  Yours, Faceter team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Recently we have sent a survey where we wanted to find out where you come from and how you interact with the cryptocurrencies’ world. The poll has largely confirmed our assumptions, so let’s take a quick look at the results.  Geography of our audience. We were thrilled to see that we are surrounded by like-minded people from all over the world — from Japan to Britain, and from Dubai to Ukraine. We also send greetings to everyone who participated in the survey and thanks to you! You are the best!    Where are you used to receive news about cryptocurrencies and blockchain? It is entirely predictable, but in 2018 it is easier to receive information directly from social networks, rather than through websites. If you have favourite channels, public accounts or other sources of information — share with us, we really wonder to know who you trust and whom you like to read.    Where do you prefer to discuss crypto news? In this issue, it is an impressive and exciting fact that Reddit is still more popular than BitcoinTalk as a platform for discussing crypto. Also, in the additional answers, you have often mentioned Discord. Maybe it’s time for us to join this platform?   What media do you regularly read? Coindesk and Cointelegraph won entirely predictably. It’s nice to see that you also appreciated the excellent resource — Hackernoon.   Which media do you not like/do not trust? A high percentage of mistrust for Merkle and Coindesk is understandable, but we did not expect to see such a level of suspicion towards the CCN. It’s really interesting, why there are many users dissatisfied with this media. If you know, share your thoughts with us.   Do you read e-mail newsletters? We were pleasantly surprised that so many people read our newsletter regularly, and also many read our letters if they were interested in the topic. Having received such feedback, we will try to make the newsletter even more interesting for you.   What information content from Faceter you would be interested in? We know that most of all you are interested in the process and progress of development. That’s why we decided to tell you regularly about what we are doing right now. By the way, the last update was released earlier this week. There you will find out that the corporate version is ready for installation, and the mobile application integrates with smart vision right now and more other exciting news.   By the way, we also see what other formats you are interested in, and we will definitely take this information into account.  Thanks again to everyone who participated in the survey, who supports and helps us. The development of our product systematically moves to the cherished point on the roadmap, and as we approach, we are preparing to make ourselves known “as loud as possible”. Your support assists us in this.  Yours, Faceter Team.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Analogue systems are starting to be displaced by the owners as well as by the authorities. The European Union has entered into a regulation called GDPR which says that people's data, including face images, must be encrypted and stored without the ability of third parties to access them. And on the request of a person who is within the range of the camera, all the recordings on which that person is recognizable must be made available to him free of charge within 30 days from request.  In analogue systems, we are not able to put so many employees to view archival materials to search hundreds of thousands of hours of recordings to find one face. Cities with CCTV, banks, shopping centres, supermarkets etc. will have to change systems to digital ones with the possibility of face recognition. The penalty for not meeting EU requirements is huge and amounts to 10 million euro or up to 2% of the annual global turnover of an enterprise.  Faceter will be the fastest and the simplest safe solution to this problem.   Here is described in more detail what effect GDPR has on CCTV:  https://blog.infinigate.co.uk/everything-you-need-to-know-about-cctv-gdpr

Author: Faceter

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hi Everyone!  We’ve got many questions from you. Most of them are about our project, goals and commerce. In this Q&A, we’ll try to give you some answers on the most important ones.  Why are sales and commerce so low? Well, the reason lays beyond the current sales and commerce conditions — altcoins sales have become pretty risky, and they aren’t in the priority of the cryptocurrency community for now. We believe that upcoming listings on the new exchanges are about to solve this issue.  When is the app going to be released, when does the mining start? We keep moving by the announced roadmap. There’s a lot of work to make Faceter’s product stable, usable and modern service. Anyway, we aimed to release beta version by the end of the year.  Also, FACE tokens will be available for mining with our computer network, namely in 2019. We are actively exploring the possibility of the earlier computing launch with the capacity of such projects as SONM or Golem. In this case, tokens will be involved in our ecosystem earlier through the atomic token swap mechanism.  When can we expect the next listing? We are currently having conversations with several exchanges, including the major ones. However, with the way the market changes over the last six months, the trade platforms also change the listing rules. Anyway, we don’t have any problems to follow that rules, so we keep working on it right now.  The new announces are about to come!  Follow us in Telegram announcement chat or any other channel you like to get all important information.  Yours, Faceter Team

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Faceter buyback program and a description of how it will work:   After Faceter starts making a profit, it will allocate ~20% of our revenues to buy out FACE tokens to replenish the reserve pool on a quarterly basis. The buy-out price will be based on the market value of FACE token, but not below its nominal value.  FACE token buy-out mechanism:  Based on quarterly results, ~20% of the company's revenue will be allocated to the token buy-out pull. Preparatory measures before the start of the buyout procedure will take about one month.  Faceter issues a smart contract to purchase tokens with a fixed amount and a fixed closing date.  Faceter users will be informed of the opportunity to sell their tokens. Token holders will be able to send their tokens for sale until the critical point is reached – an amount covering the buy-out of a certain number of tokens defined b y the smart contract.  Token holders will be able to send and revoke their tokens prior to the closing date of the smart contract. After the closing date, the number of tokens will be fixed and all participants will be sent funds in proportion to the number of tokens remaining on the contract.    Source: https://t.me/faceter    https://coinidol.com/upload/medialibrary/899/899c35ab154f27212648ea18f3c832e3.jpg

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hello, friends!  We are happy to announce that, as we promised earlier, another listing will take place this month. On June 25th FACE Token will appear on the Coinexchange.io. We know that this exchange is quite popular among our contributors, that’s why we are glad to have reached the agreement on our listing.  If you have no experience with exchanges, but you want to start, there are a lot of excellent opportunities for you there - a large number of unique tokens, respectful attitude to personal privacy and simple registration. Also, if you like small and promising trade platforms, our next announcement will be very appreciated - FACE token is already available on the very young exchange - wandx.co.  If these exchanges do not suit you according to any reason - then remember, that we are working with all popular exchanges and we will continue the process of listing on other trade platforms. Follow our news - they definitely will not leave you unsatisfied.  Moreover, if you missed, it is highly recommended to see our latest tech-update (goo.gl/8ouaNv), in which we have briefly described the activities of the past few weeks. A little earlier in “the news from the dev fields” (goo.gl/vFd6uy) we have demonstrated our latest achievements in machine learning and recognition technology.  For the nearest future we are preparing more pleasant surprises for you, but we need your help to make it work. Please find two minutes and go through our survey (goo.gl/2ocixngoo.gl/2ocixn). It will help the project very much.  Yours, Faceter

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: This is a system that uses IP CCTV cameras. You will be able to buy one and install it at home or in the driveway.  Faceter will recognize people within the range of the camera and inform you using the application about the results. You will have a list there when a person appeared. Add artificial intelligence to this and the system starts defending you against threats.  Example. People in masks appear under your home - Faceter calls the police and he informs you. People who you have added to the blacklist with the possibility of annotation for what they were written in. When Faceter recognizes them you will get an alarm on the phone and all dates of appearance will be kept. He notices the smoke and the fire - sends an alarm to the fire brigade for help. etc.

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hi Everyone!  You left almost half a thousand comments and wishes in the latest poll and we can not ignore them. Want to know details?  Here we go!  Your support    We would like to thank you for all your kind words — it was extremely important for us to receive SO much appreciation. We promise not to go down in flames and to consider all the feedbacks given to us.  More news!   You might have already noticed that we work hard to set up the process and provide you with the most up to date information and experimenting with convenient formats. Recently Faceter joined Reddit and Steemit, please choose any channel you prefer to follow us.  Extra Telegram channel  This is a good idea. We are going to make it for you, as we see the demand in it.  Android application  Earlier we announced our iOS app, Android app is under development and coming very soon.  Visiting exhibitions and events  Many questions were related to Consensus and as we expected, the event was mostly associated with a fashion party rather than a useful activity for a crypto community. Our main goal is to attend truly useful and open to the public events, like this one:  If you know of any event where you really would like to see us — please share your ideas with us.  AMA with CEO  This is a good feedback and we will arrange our CEO to visit our channels in live this month. More details will follow soon.  Some joke  Hmm…we’ll think about it; D  And the last …  Please tell, how many projects listed on Binance as the first exchange do you know? … … Do you know why?  Of course we aim to be listed on Binance, but first we have to meet a number of requirements, e.g. as listing on some other exchanges. Therefore, let’s close this question, just believe that we are doing our best to make this listing happen as soon as possible.  Thank you again for your participation in the survey. Always feel free to share your comments and requests. Most interesting and frequent ones will be posted in our channels.  Yours, Faceter Team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hi everyone!  We have recently shared with you our progress in machine learning. Today we want to tell you what the other part of the development team is doing. Let’s go!  Updated UI and new features We have rebuild user interface, making it more understandable for new users. Our desire is to make it handy for you, even if you have never used smart cameras before, to quickly navigate in the interface and enjoy the experience with the application. Also, we’ve added new ways of forming camera lists and remade the current dashboard. Every week, we add new interface details that did not exist in MVP. We added error screens, invalid data entry, camera reset function and much more. There are just some of the new examples of the interface design:   Net Video Recorders Faceter now fully supports three new types of devices. There are: Hikvision https://www.hikvision.com/en/ Provision-ISR http://www.provision-isr.com/ Dahuahttps://www.dahuasecurity.com/ This list will undoubtedly grow. Now you can connect one NVR and get access to all video streams from all cameras that are connected to it.  Android  Yes, we have started the development of the Android-version of the application. Now we are ready to shed a bit more light on this. The Android team is transferring the actual groundwork of iOS team. Although it will take some time, we are sure that at some point the teams will become equal and applications will release with minimal lag from each other. Install on your own server For all comers and especially corporate clients, we have provided the opportunity to install all the software on your server and connect directly to them, bypassing any intermediaries.  Alfa QA We want to make the Faceter app as convenient as possible out of the box, and for sure we understand that its popularity will largely depend on it. That is why we have already started the stage of alfa-application testing. Tester Darya joined our team (welcome Daria), and now the programmers will have even more work (the development department is so-o-o happy now).  Integration of “computer vision” We have started the direct integration of our primary product into a commercial version of the application, which will be available to everyone. For now, this is not our initial task, but to fully meet our roadmap goals, we have already begun to test these functions. We could also tell you about the new tests with SONM, the video playback optimisation in the web application and other minor improvements, but we’ll leave it for the next time.  If you are interested in such news, please show this with your activity — like and comment. We will be happy to share our success with you on an ongoing basis.See you next time! And do not hesitate to join us in Telegram Chat(https://t.me/faceter).  Yours, Faceter team

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Q&A #1 Hi Everyone! We have some popular questions that have received in the previous few months. Most likely, many of you are also interested in the information required for other community members. Therefore, we decided to share with you some answers to the most interesting questions.  Let’s go!  1. Why tokens can not be sent back, if I send them to the token contract address? ( How is the token contract address used?) FACE Tokens sent to the FACE Token Contract address are non-reversible and cannot be sent back to the sender.  Why this happens: The token contract (and the token contract address) is the tool for token emission, distribution and track. It is not a wallet address and it can not be used as an address to receive tokens. Once you send tokens to the contract address itself — tokens are stuck there and can not be pulled back.  2. Can you give any comments on GDPR? We align with the data protection and privacy regulations requirements from the latest legislations and we are going to follow all provisions of the GDPR. Our legal team together with the technical staff are carefully studying the requirements of the GDPR both for Faceter service provision and Faceter website/applications compliance with all the GDPR requirements.  3. Can you give a comprehensive and plain explanation of the last tech update? Right now we are developing our own software, where “computer vision” will be installed. We are not going to offer services to implement our technologies as it does, for example, IBM. We want to provide the outstanding technology along with the good software and be the first in the market, like, for example, Apple.  Therefore, right now a part of the technical department headed by CTO continues to work on the main project, when another part develops and updates applications for iOS and Android. The article on Medium describes the work of the first part of developers and shows improvements in face recognition made by applying the new algorithm: it means that Faceter developers have improved the recognition methodology and have increased the percentage of successful recognitions. Soon we will also give you some updates on the work of other Faceter developers.  4. Why are people from Faceter team not presented on the website and LinkedIn? We represent only the key team members on the website. Also, we asked them to update their profiles on LinkedIn too. We do not require this for all other employees. They decide personally either to indicate this information or not. If the team has new faces with high responsibility, we will add them to the website too.  5. Are you still going to use SONM? Currently, there are no existing decentralised computing solutions with a long-standing reputation that’s why we have nothing to rely on. So, we design Faceter core to be able to run in different environments. The top priority for us is to keep our software as a stand-alone solution and be able to run directly on miner’s machines. However, anyway we stay conformed with our intention to support other networks like SONM or Golem. Their teams may already resolve many challenges in such systems, so consider them as a way of moving faster through our roadmap.  We suppose it is enough for the first time. Leave your questions in the comments, and we will give answers on the most interesting one the next time.  Yours, Faceter Team

Author: eren0x
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Faceter is the first decentralized surveillance system for consumers. Faceter makes video surveillance smart, giving brains to cameras through enhanced face detection, object detection and real-time video analysis. These features allow cameras to understand the situation and respond to it, offering much better security to all the customers. At Faceter’s technological core is the absolute respect for privacy, and the utilization of the features of convolutional neural networks to split the tasks reinforces this commitment. As a result, sensitive data is always processed in a completely trusted environment, and all images not subject to recovery are passed to the decentralized network.

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hello everyone!  Good news - the date of the first listing is finally here:  On May 25th, the FACE token will be available for everyone on the HitBTC exchange. If you or someone you know wanted but didn’t participate in the tokensale, on the 25th you have a chance to catch up; but that is not all! If you are not an active user of our first exchange, don’t worry - next month we will announce further cooperations!  We are not going to stop on this. While our development team is making great progress in creating a mass-product version of Faceter video surveillance solution and optimization of mining, we are also working to ensure that each contributor will have the opportunity to see our token listed on the most convenient exchange (the survey on this topic is coming soon).  This is a very exciting moment - the beginning of the “public” life of our token and the whole project. We are very pleased that this moment has finally come. Thank you for your patience.  Your Faceter team!

Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: New Video from Robert Pothier https://youtu.be/poCsxRJg9DI  Dear contributors! With the token sale at an end, the Faceter team together with all Faceter contributors will experience a very fascinating journey upon the roadmap we have committed too. FACE token distribution is going well. The main part of tokens was successfully delivered to the contributors, who added their addresses.  This means that almost all contributors have their FACE tokens on their wallets. If you still have not added the ERC20 address with access to private keys, please do it ASAP! As per our roadmap; CTO Vladimir is expanding our IT department, moving forward with smart recognition and has reached a new milestone. The Faceter tech team is now developing new algorithms with race and gender recognition options. This is a major step in a new and smarter technology of recognition. The algorithm is based on the same one used in our PoCs and there will be a lot of tech details coming very soon. As per contributors choice (via voting in Faceter contributor’s accounts) exchange listing takes place in May and Faceter will bring FACE to exchanges in the next few weeks! Stay tuned and do not forget to follow us on Twitter https://twitter.com/FaceterOfficial for exciting news, soon to follow.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Yes, I'm from the 80's and I'm 30+.  I do not drink alcohol at all now, I tried it in my youth, but I probably never got drunk as you write. However, it is like you say that no one had telephones with cameras and even if I got drunk no one would record it.  But I still think that I prefer to have a camera on the phone and know that someone can take a picture, than that there were no cameras on the phones. I supports the technological progress and it is my passion.  As for banks, I still have a bank account and I use cards. I pay bills via the internet from a bank account, etc. I treat crypto as the future, that will take place in the world order known to us.  Of course, I would prefer that no one knows what I spend and how much, but I know so far, that for the convenience of paying via an online bank I have to deprive myself of privacy in these matters. I have crypto currency as a capital investment. In my country, you can not pay for services or goods with crypto - with few exceptions.  If I were 16 years old, then I would probably write that I want privacy, that no one should record me when I'm on the street, etc. It seems to me that, when I am older is the more I value the protection of my family, my health, and my property. I am not doing anything illegal to be afraid of the camera on the street or in the store. For this feeling of security for my children coming back from school is very important for me.  Of course I understand your opinion and I respect it, but you will not convince me that video surveillance is something that I should fear, that someone will use it against me.

Author: dzonikg28
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Congratulations to a seemingly perfect life then. What if you had a psychological problem and didn't want your insurance to know (for many good reasons)? Would you pay privately? Does your psychiatrist take cash? Oh, now your banker knows you have a problem. They are data mining like fuck. Did you ever talk to someone working at a bank? They do know everything although they are "not allowed" to arbitrarily check how it's going for you. There must be other systems, better systems, working with less mass surveillance. I am all for those systems and at the same time I want security. That doesn't mean I have to be satisfied with the status quo. New systems shouldn't mean less security. We are all here to improve what we have.  There is a business working on impulse control chips that can be implemented into the brain. If someone shows signs of becoming very brutal, that person could theoretically opt to implement that chip. If you had only one choice in the following scenario, what would you pick: you meet a potentially extremely brutal person in a corner where there is a Faceter camera, or you meet a potentially extremely brutal person with that chip in his head? I know it sounds crazy, just interested in your opinion

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: If I had to pay a psychiatrist, I would choose cash, for which reason you write. In my country you can still pay cash everywhere. I know that people are abusing knowledge derived from databases. I used to work in a military commission on the usefulness of men for the army. I had all the data regarding them. I admit that they collect too much data and too much data is available to people working there.   But back to the topic, Faceter is just for the protection of sensitive data. So far, buying a similar service in the cloud all the recordings were on third-party servers (I will not mention the biggest names, but we all know what companies offer computing power in the cloud). Faceter divides this data into small parts, turns images into lines that connect individual elements of the face and gives randomly chosen miners. Here no one has access to images and to the result data, i.e. face maps that allow face recognition. In addition, everything is encrypted and only the person with the private key has access. Here, there is no question of transferring data to various companies, employees or data leakage from the cloud in the event of an attack or deliberate disclosure by the cloud owner.  "New systems shouldn't mean less security. We are all here to improve what we have." - That's exactly what I think and that's why in my opinion Faceter gives us such data protection, which other CCTV systems could not meet.  Returning to the last part of your statement, I have not heard about such chips, but theoretically, I can answer your question anyway. Here, Faceter probably would not be useful, because before he called for help, an aggressive attack could take place. Who would win it is not known, because as I wrote it, I have not been drinking alcohol for several years because I go to the gym and I have ruled out it deliberately. I am quite big now, I do not know whether he would have an advantage, I suspect that he would not attack me;)  As for the chips, I have no idea who would decide on their implantation, what level of aggression would be sufficient to qualify the person for such an operation. Could such chip have been able to reduce aggression significantly? If so, it can also be a good technology that would prevent many crimes. Who knows.

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: 61,358,389.66 FACE Burnt  Thank you very much for supporting Faceter! After the Token Sale, we remain true to our proposed roadmap and today we have an important announcement to make. Faceter is announcing a burn of 61,358,389.66 FACE that effectively reduces the total supply of the FACE Token.  How and why Faceter burnt tokens?  61,358,389.66 FACE Tokens were burnt over 4 transactions. The first transaction was a test burning of 1 FACE, while the following 3 transactions burnt tokens from 3 pools.  How it works: Our smart contract includes “burn” feature. FACE Tokens are transferred from our contract to the special address (0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000) and these tokens can not be sent back. Such Tokens were eliminated from the total supply and do not exist in the Faceter contract any more.  Accounts with less than 500 tokens (9,385,809.84 FACE): Faceter has committed that there will not be any Airdrop, so all bonus tokens, remaining on accounts with less than 500 FACE were burnt. We have also made a list of all accounts from those tokens were burnt, it is a list of masked emails and amount of tokens (that was burnt). You can find the list here:https://tokensale.faceter.io/faceter_burn.pdf  Advisors tokens (48,300,128.82 FACE): not all tokens from the advisors pool were used for advisors remuneration. As a result, we decided to burn all FACE Tokens remaining in the Advisors remuneration pool.  Bounty program tokens (3,672,450 FACE): as we previously announced, Bounty program was cancelled in favour of a limited bonus offering to early Token Sale contributors, not all FACE were used and the remaining amount was burnt.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: You see, a lot of computing power is needed for the calculations needed to detect faces and recognize them on the recorded material.  Faceter invented a system cheaper than cloud computing, named fog computing, which will use miners for calculations. The whole system of accounting for miners, verification of their calculations and valuation of their work is based on blockchain.  Thanks to blokchain we can be sure that the calculations are correct, because they will be made by several miners and then they will be compared with each other if they are identical. Data about people faces will be obfuscate and no miner will have access to all data as it did in the cloud. And for the end, each user will have a private key and no one will be able to view data from his recordings without his consent.  Licenses for the use of Faceter will be available through Face tokens, some of which will be burned every time they receive a monthly license (about 20% of it). To facilitate the purchase of a license, you can buy it for fiat but Faceter, to activate it on the blockchain and assign miners to it, will have to get it by exchanging fiat money for tokens to sign it with the correct key.  Therefore, every quarter Faceter will spend 20% of its revenues to buy back of tokens from investors at market prices for current operation.

Author: dzonikg28
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: I am not sure how old you are, but if you are 30+, may I ask you if you have ever been drunken as fuck and puked in a public location when you were 16? Did someone take a picture of it? No, probably nobody did and do you know why? Because hardly anyone had a mobile phone with a camera. Do you think it would have been better if there were pictures about it? Do you know that the NSA can watch you while you are having sex in case you have a TV or mobile phone at your bed? I am not saying this technology is bad per se, but it gives a minority of people which are behind the cameras a lot of potential to abuse information.  You are into digital currencies. Let me ask you why? Is it because you think it is time for more privacy so that your banker can't see anymore what you spend your money on? Good point, I dislike the fact that my banker knows everything. There are many points that speak against total surveillance, but that doesn't mean we don't need it.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Team: An international team with extensive R&D experience at computer vision, as well as managing a high-tech international business.  Robert Pothier CEO, Co-founder - Top manager with an impressive experience in large companies (Pinnacle Micro, Walletone.com, etc). He developed and implemented projects in the fields of e-wallets, gambling, KYC, as well as banking solutions in the United Kingdom, Spain, Italy and several African countries.   Vladimir Tchernitski Co-founder, CTO - Professional with 20 years of experience in software development and 4 years in neural networks, computer vision and biometry algorithm development. Was a head of the R&D team of the outsourcing software developing company for several years.   Paul Scott Business Development - Seasoned professional in financial markets and emerging-market technologies with deep-level FinTech, InsurTech and Big Data ecosystem knowledge, including utilisation of leading-edge technologies. The focus for the last 2-years has become the inherent benefits in Blockchain technology and the nascent opportunities this presents for a decentralised global economy.   Leon Olckers Technical Deployments - CCTV security expert with over 10 years experience in the industry. Was involved in biometrics and ID management projects while offering video surveillance solutions, access control, electronic article surveillance, intrusion detection and customer behaviour analysis. Being a General Manger at Fullhouse Company, has completed numerous security state level projects while exceeding expectations with high quality solutions and service delivery.   Jayson Gouws Solutions and Distribution - Specialist in security technologies with more than 20 years of experience. Vast experience in the sale of video surveillance systems and large-scale security projects at the regional and city levels.   Graham Perry Sales and Distribution - With over 30 years of industry experience Graham has worked for organizations such as British Aerospace, De La Rue, Fuji, SAP and Microsoft, as well as creating and building several start-up ventures of his own. He has been involved in the Security and Built Environment sector for the past 15 years and has extensive client experience throughout both Europe and Africa.   Aleksandr Chernov Tech Lead - Expert in full-stack administration, as well as front-end and backend programming. Professional in product design and analytics. Worked as a team leader and a system analyst at walletone.com, taaasty.com and others.   Anton Ivashkevich Design - Professional with 8 years of product design experience. Expertise areas are adaptive web and mobile interfaces, design, prototyping. Worked as a lead designer in projects with millions of users (Viber Wallet and more).   Vitaliy Kuzmenko Mobile Development - High qualified Mobile developer and UI expert with 5 years of experience. Worked on mobile solutions for walletone.com, pay.cards, taaasty.com and siberian.pro projects.  Advisors:  Igor Karavaev Investor Relations - Serial investor relations advisor of blockchain projects, top expert at icobench. Ex-executive Director at the Skolkovo Foundation, the leading Russian business incubator of hi-tech start-ups. Worked as a head of strategy, investments and business development of the largest international corporations.   Ken Huang Senior Academic Advisor - Before joining Huawei in December 2015, Ken worked for CGI Federal office in USA for 18 years and served as its Director of Cyber Security and Director of Cloud Security. He established CGI Federal Identity Management Practice during his time at CGI. He has consulted to the United States Federal Government, numerous Financial Institutions and utility companies, providing expertise in Finance, Blockchain and Cyber Security.

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: FACE Token distribution has started!  We would like to take the opportunity to thank all our contributors for your support and patience.  We are pleased to announce that our FACE Token distribution has just started. All Tokens that were purchased during Faceter Token Sale and all bonuses applied to early contributors are now available for distribution to your ERC20 wallets. However, many contributors have not entered a ERC20 wallet address into the address section of their Faceter account. Please do it, to get your tokens!  General information on FACE Token. Address: 0x1CCAA0F2a7210d76E1fDec740d5F323E2E1b1672 Ticker: FACE Decimals: 18  IMPORTANT: Please make sure that you have read the following information very carefully before contacting us regarding your tokens.  Airdrop. Faceter does not have any Airdrop as announced before. If you have less than 500 tokens and you have no purchases — your tokens are NOT distributable and will be burnt.  Locking period. All distributed tokens will be locked on your wallet utill the 1st official exchange listing. Exchanges. The date of FACE to hit the 1st official exchange will be announced later. We are doing our best to hit the exchanges as soon as possible.  Distribution process. You can check the distribution process via the official FACE Token address: 0x1CCAA0F2a7210d76E1fDec740d5F323E2E1b1672  How to add FACE Token to wallet?  To add FACE Token to your wallet please use only the official FACE Token address!  MyEtherWallet (MEW) After you login to myetherwallet.com, click “Add Custom Token”, then fill in the following details: Address: 0x1CCAA0F2a7210d76E1fDec740d5F323E2E1b1672 Ticker: FACE Decimals: 18  MIST After you login to Ethereum Wallet/ Mist, click “Contracts”, then “Watch token” to open the “Add token” window. In “Token contract address”, enter: 0x1CCAA0F2a7210d76E1fDec740d5F323E2E1b1672 Then, add/verify the details of the token. Token name: FACE Token Token Symbol: FACE Decimal places: 18  MetaMask After you login to your MetaMask Wallet, click on the “Tokens” tab, then click on the “Add tokens” button. On the Add Tokens screen, fill in the information below and click ‘add’: Address: 0x1CCAA0F2a7210d76E1fDec740d5F323E2E1b1672 Token Symbol: FACE Decimals: 18  To check if your tokens are already transferred please follow these steps: Go to: https://etherscan.io/token/0x1ccaa0f2a7210d76e1fdec740d5f323e2e1b1672 Enter personal wallet address added in Faceter account in the field “Search/Filter By” and press “Apply” button. Results: a) if you see that you have FACE tokens, then transfer was complete and you can add token to your wallet; b) if you see that you have 0 FACE tokens, then transfer was not complete, please wait for 24 hours; c) if your ERC20 compatible wallet address was not added to your Faceter account prior to token distribution, the token distribution after entering the ERC20 compatible wallet address will take up to 24 hours.  For Live Support & Faceter Discussion, join over 22000 Faceter supporters on Telegram and make sure to follow us on Twitter.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: I do not see any obstacles to use Faceter wherever there are already CCTV cameras today. Each person who appears in the lens is automatically added to the database, a record will be added along with the time of appearance of that person. You do not have to manually add people to the database. You can manually enter additional information about the person but you do not have to add the person manually. From the first appearance, a face icon will be created and all subsequent appearances will be stored. Choosing a person after the image of the face will be saved all the frames in which he appears.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Faceter use blockchain for building a decentralized infrastructure (so called fog computing), which will meet the requirements of the facial recognition tasks. The so-called miners will give their GPU the computation needed for the service. FACE tokens will be used for receiving payments from customers and fix orders in smart-contracts, and transferring payment to miners.  A main advantage is the cost reducing by the use of Fog of miners for the computation. And for real world the price issue is one of the most crucial, so the decentralized approach and cost advantage that is what Faceter is going for.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Faceter are going to improve privacy, not to broke it.  Today people are recorded on a video hundreds times a day and their faces are saved in different libraries. It is mandatory consequences of digitalisation and no one can change this. Faceter will come into the market in accordance with local regulations on personal data protection. This is a vast research area and Faceter are not going to ignore it.  Faceter don't store any information about the person behind the face, such as Facebook. Faceter create a number hash of your face - a neural map - and nothing else. Privacy is a key feature of this technology.  You will have two methods to store your data.  First, storage on secure private Faceter cloud, where each customer shall have all his encrypted data stored for his account with private keys for each account. Second, data storage on customer side, for users who want to have full control over their database.  Both solutions make database of each customer a proprietary base, that can not be used by third parties without customer consent. So your family faces will be securely stored in your database.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: I was referring to the business model, the fee will be charged for the monthly service performed by Faceter and fog miners and not for the program as such. Apps will be free to download. This is the best business model for distributing software. You do not have to spend a lot of money right away, the developer has to make sure that the service is at the highest level every month and often improve the product because the buyer decides every month whether he will buy the service again or not.  Of course, I can not imagine that the Faceter did not make a demo version for people who want to see what facial recognition looks like before they buy a monthly subscription. But this is a marketing decision and let's leave it to specialists when the program is up and running.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Tokens will be distributed this week from 6 to 7 April.  All investors will be notified by email about the exact time of sending.  When it comes to the exchange, they are still working on it, but this is a process and not a decision, so we have to wait. So far Faceter listens to all opinions and implements them just like the investors are yelling, what is very good imho.

Author: micz_bjukanon
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: So far you can only buy tokens but in the end how the whole service will go in the fog will be needed miners for these calculations allowing the recognition of faces, objects. Miners will receive remuneration in the form of FACE tokens for this work.  So you can earn FACE tokens for renting your equipment but it will be possible until year.  The company will have to repurchase its own tokens from investors every quarter in order to be able to create licenses for users, pay miners and the rest will be burned.  Everything is described in the white paper in the "Faceter token use model" section, on pages 30 - 32. https://tokensale.faceter.io/Faceter_Whitepaper_en.pdf  Buying tokens and burning parts of them creates deflation, which together with the growing number of users should translate into an increase in the price of FACE tokens.

Author: Faceter
Title: [ANN][ICO] FACETER – computer vision surveillance technology
Body: Hello! Now we are going to follow the steps set in our roadmap. Developing in parallel the following things now in 2019: Building modular architecture and adapting Faceter to fog computing networks to reduce computation costs; Developing Android, iOS, Apple TV applications (iOS and Apple TV Apps are ready, you can check them with demo); Developing a module for classifying individuals in videos to augment the event-based model with the following features: sex, age, race, emotions.  Also we are going to start recruiting new team members for the growing IT department and will launch beta version of Faceter running on a fog and starting sales in the mass market segment.  This are our nearest plans Also token distribution will take place soon and we are preparing great announcements on exchanges for FACE token.
